Which method should I use to create the Glasshouse look?

  • Aluminium Partitioning
  • Interior Design
  • Sliding Systems
  • Industry Insight
  • Inspiration
  • Case Studies
  • Whitepapers
  • Social & Events
  • Design Details & Drawings
14th Aug 2015
Comment
Back

Which method should I use to create the Glasshouse look?

The choice is yours – there are 2 options shown in the scenarios below which will help you decide!

Option 1: Creating Glasshouse look with Frame

Â Renders above are shown in the Platinum 120 system. This design concept can be used in all Platinum & Definium systems.

Creating the glasshouse look with frame provides a substantial multi-dimensional feel with an endless range of spacing between horizontal transoms and vertical mullions.

This concept can be achieved quickly and easily by using the drillings for fast and accurate installation.

The finished result: a consistent, bold and clean look

Â 

Â 

Option 2: Creating Glasshouse look with Flat Bar

Renders above are shown in the Platinum 120 system. This design concept can be used in all Platinum & Definium systems.

Creating the glasshouse look with flat bar creates a flexible minimal feel. This concept can be achieved quickly and easily by using high bond double-sided tape or silicone on the flat bar and adhering to glass.

Criterion stocks a range of flat bars to match the Platinum 35mm reveal and the Definium 50mm reveal.

The finished result: a minimalist, crisp, streamlined finish

Â 

 

Which option do you prefer? The bold frame option or the minimalistic flat bar option?

Let us know in the comments below!

About Criterion

Criterion Industries is focused on the supply of an innovative range of aluminium partitioning systems and solutions to the building and commercial fit-out industry. We have a large service network, with offices and warehouses in Melbourne, Sydney and Perth.
